quests.desc: Hey, thanks for coming over to TextWorld! Please pick up the banana from the floor of the cellar.
commands: unlock non-euclidean gate with non-euclidean passkey
unlock American limited edition door with American limited edition passkey
unlock non-euclidean gate with non-euclidean passkey
unlock American limited edition door with American limited edition passkey

infos.name: office
infos.desc:
Okay, so you're in an office, cool, but is it ordinary? You better believe it is.

 You see an armchair. The armchair is usual.[if there is something on the s_0] On the armchair you can see [a list of things on the s_0].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_0] The armchair appears to be empty. What, you think everything in TextWorld should have stuff on it?[end if]

 There is [if d_3 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] passageway leading east. There is an unguarded exit to the north. There is an exit to the west. Don't worry, it is unblocked.

infos.name: steam room
infos.desc:
You've just shown up in a steam room.

 You can make out a box.[if c_0 is open and there is something in the c_0] The box contains [a list of things in the c_0].[end if][if c_0 is open and the c_0 contains nothing] Empty! What kind of nightmare TextWorld is this?[end if] You make out [if c_1 is locked]a locked[else if c_1 is open]an opened[otherwise]a closed[end if] cabinet.[if c_1 is open and there is something in the c_1] The cabinet contains [a list of things in the c_1].[end if][if c_1 is open and the c_1 contains nothing] What a letdown! The cabinet is empty![end if]

There is an exit to the east. Don't worry, it is unblocked.

infos.name: cookery
infos.desc:
You've fallen into a normal room. Your mind races to think of what kind of room would be normal. And then it hits you. Of course. You're in the cookery.



You need an unblocked exit? You should try going north. You don't like doors? Why not try going south, that entranceway is unblocked. You need an unblocked exit? You should try going west.

infos.name: cubicle
infos.desc:
You've just walked into a cubicle. I guess you better just go and list everything you see here.

 You make out a chair. What a coincidence, weren't you just thinking about a chair? [if there is something on the s_1]You see [a list of things on the s_1] on the chair.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_1]However, the chair, like an empty chair, has nothing on it. It would have been so cool if there was stuff on the chair.[end if]

There is an unguarded exit to the east. You need an unblocked exit? You should try going north. You need an unblocked exit? You should try going south.

infos.name: salon
infos.desc:
You're now in the salon.

 Hey, want to see a portmanteau? Look over there, a portmanteau, so there's that.[if c_2 is open and there is something in the c_2] The portmanteau contains [a list of things in the c_2], so there's that.[end if][if c_2 is open and the c_2 contains nothing] The portmanteau is empty, what a horrible day![end if] What's that over there? It looks like it's a shelf. The shelf is standard.[if there is something on the s_2] On the shelf you make out [a list of things on the s_2].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_2] But oh no! there's nothing on this piece of junk. You think about smashing the shelf to bits, throwing the bits into the garbage, etc, until you get bored.[end if]

There is an unblocked exit to the south. There is an exit to the west. Don't worry, it is unguarded.

infos.name: attic
infos.desc:
You arrive in an attic. A standard kind of place.

 You see a gleam over in a corner, where you can see a counter. [if there is something on the s_3]You see [a list of things on the s_3] on the counter. You shudder, but continue examining the room.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_3]But there isn't a thing on it. Hopefully, this discovery doesn't ruin your TextWorld experience![end if] You see a stand. [if there is something on the s_4]On the stand you see [a list of things on the s_4].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_4]Unfortunately, there isn't a thing on it. Aw, here you were, all excited for there to be things on it![end if]

There is an unguarded exit to the east. You need an unguarded exit? You should try going south. You need an unblocked exit? You should try going west.

infos.name: basement
infos.desc:
Fancy seeing you here. Here, by the way, being the basement.



You don't like doors? Why not try going east, that entranceway is unblocked.

infos.name: laundry place
infos.desc:
You've just sauntered into a laundry place.



 There is [if d_2 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] American limited edition door leading south. There is [if d_1 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] gateway leading west.

infos.name: scullery
infos.desc:
You are in a scullery. It seems to be pretty normal here.

 You see a chest. You can't wait to tell the folks at home about this![if c_3 is open and there is something in the c_3] The chest contains [a list of things in the c_3]. What a great pairing of adjectives and nouns![end if][if c_3 is open and the c_3 contains nothing] The chest is empty! This is the worst thing that could possibly happen, ever![end if] You scan the room, seeing a bowl. [if there is something on the s_5]On the bowl you can see [a list of things on the s_5].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_5]But oh no! there's nothing on this piece of garbage.[end if] You scan the room, seeing a pan. What a coincidence, weren't you just thinking about a pan? [if there is something on the s_6]You see [a list of things on the s_6] on the pan.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_6]But there isn't a thing on it. Oh! Why couldn't there just be stuff on it?[end if]

 There is [if d_1 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] gateway leading east. There is [if d_0 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] non-euclidean gate leading south. There is an exit to the north. Don't worry, it is unblocked.

infos.name: study
infos.desc:
You find yourself in a study. An usual kind of place.

 You can see a display. You look around you, at all the containers and supporters, doors and objects, and you think to yourself. Why? Why Textworld?[if c_4 is open and there is something in the c_4] The display contains [a list of things in the c_4]. You look around you, at all the containers and supporters, doors and objects, and you think to yourself. Why? Why Textworld?[end if][if c_4 is open and the c_4 contains nothing] Empty! What kind of nightmare TextWorld is this?[end if] You see a mantle. The mantle is typical.[if there is something on the s_7] On the mantle you make out [a list of things on the s_7].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_7] But the thing hasn't got anything on it.[end if]

There is an unblocked exit to the east. There is an exit to the south. Don't worry, it is unblocked. You don't like doors? Why not try going west, that entranceway is unguarded.

infos.name: cellar
infos.desc:
You find yourself in a cellar. A standard kind of place.

 Oh wow! Is that what I think it is? It is! It's a suitcase. Make a note of this, you might have to put stuff on or in it later on.[if c_5 is open and there is something in the c_5] The suitcase contains [a list of things in the c_5].[end if][if c_5 is open and the c_5 contains nothing] Empty! What kind of nightmare TextWorld is this?[end if] You can see a workbench. [if there is something on the s_8]On the workbench you make out [a list of things on the s_8].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_8]But the thing is empty, unfortunately. Oh! Why couldn't there just be stuff on it?[end if]

You need an unguarded exit? You should try going east. There is an unblocked exit to the north. There is an exit to the south. Don't worry, it is unguarded.

infos.name: closet
infos.desc:
You are in a closet. A normal kind of place.



 There is [if d_3 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] passageway leading west. There is an unblocked exit to the east. There is an unblocked exit to the north.

infos.name: chamber
infos.desc:
You are in a chamber. An usual one.

 You can see a desk. The desk is ordinary.[if there is something on the s_9] On the desk you can see [a list of things on the s_9].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_9] But there isn't a thing on it. Aw, here you were, all excited for there to be things on it![end if]

You need an unguarded exit? You should try going west.

infos.name: canteen
infos.desc:
You're now in a canteen.

 You lean against the wall, inadvertently pressing a secret button. The wall opens up to reveal a plate. What a coincidence, weren't you just thinking about a plate? [if there is something on the s_10]On the plate you see [a list of things on the s_10].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_10]However, the plate, like an empty plate, has nothing on it. Aw, here you were, all excited for there to be things on it![end if] You see a platter. [if there is something on the s_11]On the platter you see [a list of things on the s_11].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_11]Unfortunately, there isn't a thing on it.[end if]

You don't like doors? Why not try going east, that entranceway is unblocked. You need an unblocked exit? You should try going north. You don't like doors? Why not try going west, that entranceway is unguarded.

infos.name: garage
infos.desc:
You've entered a garage. I guess you better just go and list everything you see here.



 There is [if d_2 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] American limited edition door leading north. There is an exit to the east. Don't worry, it is unguarded. There is an exit to the south. Don't worry, it is unblocked.

infos.name: sauna
infos.desc:
You're not going to believe this, but you've just entered a sauna. You try to gain information on your surroundings by using a technique you call 'looking.'

 You can see a rack. The rack is usual.[if there is something on the s_12] On the rack you see [a list of things on the s_12]. There's something strange about this thing being here, but you don't have time to worry about that now.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_12] But the thing hasn't got anything on it. Aw, here you were, all excited for there to be things on it![end if] What's that over there? It looks like it's a table. The table is ordinary.[if there is something on the s_13] On the table you can make out [a list of things on the s_13]. You idly wonder how they came up with the name TextWorld for this place. It's pretty fitting.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_13] The table appears to be empty. Silly table, silly, empty, good for nothing table.[end if]

You need an unguarded exit? You should try going north. You don't like doors? Why not try going south, that entranceway is unblocked. There is an exit to the west. Don't worry, it is unblocked.

infos.name: kitchenette
infos.desc:
You find yourself in a kitchenette. A standard one. The room is well lit.



There is an exit to the north. Don't worry, it is unguarded. There is an unblocked exit to the west.

infos.name: spare room
infos.desc:
You're now in a spare room.



You need an unguarded exit? You should try going south.

infos.name: kitchen
infos.desc:
I am obligated to announce that you are now in the kitchen.



 There is [if d_0 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] non-euclidean gate leading north. You don't like doors? Why not try going south, that entranceway is unblocked.

infos.name: shower
infos.desc:
You're now in a shower.



You don't like doors? Why not try going north, that entranceway is unguarded.

infos.name: passageway
infos.desc: The passageway looks commanding. [if open]You can see inside it.[else if closed]You can't see inside it because the lid's in your way.[otherwise]There is a lock on it.[end if]

infos.name: gateway
infos.desc: The gateway looks stuffy. [if open]It is open.[else if closed]It is closed.[otherwise]It is locked.[end if]

infos.name: American limited edition door
infos.desc: The American limited edition door looks hefty. [if open]You can see inside it.[else if closed]You can't see inside it because the lid's in your way.[otherwise]There is a lock on it.[end if]

infos.name: non-euclidean gate
infos.desc: it is what it is, a non-euclidean gate [if open]You can see inside it.[else if closed]You can't see inside it because the lid's in your way.[otherwise]There is a lock on it.[end if]

infos.name: box
infos.desc: The box looks strong, and impossible to break. [if open]It is open.[else if closed]It is closed.[otherwise]It is locked.[end if]

infos.name: cabinet
infos.desc: The cabinet looks strong, and impossible to crack. [if open]It is open.[else if closed]It is closed.[otherwise]It is locked.[end if]

infos.name: portmanteau
infos.desc: The portmanteau looks strong, and impossible to break. [if open]You can see inside it.[else if closed]You can't see inside it because the lid's in your way.[otherwise]There is a lock on it.[end if]

infos.name: chest
infos.desc: The chest looks strong, and impossible to destroy. [if open]You can see inside it.[else if closed]You can't see inside it because the lid's in your way.[otherwise]There is a lock on it.[end if]

infos.name: display
infos.desc: The display looks strong, and impossible to crack. [if open]It is open.[else if closed]It is closed.[otherwise]It is locked.[end if]

infos.name: suitcase
infos.desc: The suitcase looks strong, and impossible to break. [if open]It is open.[else if closed]It is closed.[otherwise]It is locked.[end if]

infos.name: banana
infos.desc: You couldn't pay me to eat that normal thing.

infos.desc: You couldn't pay me to eat that usual thing.

infos.desc: The metal of the passkey is satin.

walkthrough: unlock non-euclidean gate with non-euclidean passkey
unlock American limited edition door with American limited edition passkey

objective: It's time to explore the amazing world of TextWorld! Your task for today is to pick-up the banana from the floor of the cellar.
